intro: Hoffmannia longepetiolata var. minor, commonly known as the dwarf Hoffmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun exposure. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30 cm. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and dryland landscapes.
